availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Congar Butler (Jefferson County, Kentucky, merchant, tax assessor, and notary public)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, merchant, tax collector, and notary public. Louisville, Kentucky, native. Son of Richard Butler and Abby Congar Butler. Married to Mary Ann Pilling Butler in Greensburg, Indiana, on May 30, 1849. Father of James Gillespie Butler, Mary Louisa Butler, Laura Bell Butler, and Anna Cornelia Butler. Merchant in Floyd County, Indiana, in 1850. Assistant tax collector in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1862. Notary public in Jefferson County in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Floyd County, New Albany, p. 299A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Harrods Creek, p. 332 A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994041, Jefferson County Deaths, p. 165.
"Excise Taxes." Courier-Journal (Louisville, KY), November 10, 1862.
Charles Collard Adams, Middletown Upper Houses: A History of the North Society of Middletown, Connecticut, from 1650 to 1800, with Genealogical and Biographical Chapters on Early Families and a Full Genealogy of the Ranney Family (New York: The Grafton Press, 1908), 520, 522.
KYR-0001-031-0056.
